data.text:
Yes, there are 3 Nikon outlets in Japan where you can get Nikon products and maybe even Nikon discontinued products for cheaper than the regular Nikon stores. Read on to find out the locations of these Nikon outlet factories in Japan.

Nikon is a Japanese camera company that has been making high-quality cameras for over 100 years. While the company's headquarters are located in Tokyo, Japan, most of Nikon's cameras are now made in Thailand.

However, there are still a few Nikon factory outlets in Japan where you can find discounted cameras, lenses, and accessories.

Nikon: A Brief Overview

Nikon Corporation, established in 1917, has a rich history in the photography industry.

Renowned for its precision optics and innovative technology, Nikon has consistently produced cutting-edge cameras, lenses, and other imaging equipment. With a strong commitment to quality, Nikon has earned the trust of photographers worldwide.

Are There Nikon Outlets in Japan Near Me?

Yes, there are Nikon outlets in Japan where you can get Nikon products for cheap. In fact, there are three Nikon factory outlets in Japan - you’ll find them in Toki Premium Outlets, Kobe-Sanda Premium Outlets, and Gotemba Premium Outlets, respectively.

Here are the addresses and contact information for the two Nikon outlets in Japan:

Toki Premium Outlets

Address: 1 Chome-2 Tokigaoka, Toki, Gifu 509-5127, Japan

Phone: +81 572-53-3160

Kobe-Sanda Premium Outlets

Address: Address: 5-3-1 Shinko, Hyogo 651-0087, Japan

Phone: Phone: +81 78-983-4122

Gotemba Premium Outlets

Address: 1313 Gotemba, Shizuoka 410-1104, Japan

Phone: +81 550-81-5070

What is the Nikon Outlet?

A Nikon factory outlet is a store that sells discontinued models, refurbished products, and open-box items from Nikon. The prices at the outlets are significantly lower than the retail prices for new Nikon products. This makes them a great place to find a good deal on a Nikon camera or lens.

Also, the outlets are a great place to find discontinued lenses and accessories that are no longer available from Nikon.

Related: Is Canon Cheaper In Japan?

Nikon Outlet In Japan Prices

The prices of Nikon products in the factory outlet malls in Japan vary depending on the product, but you can typically expect to save 20% to 50% off the retail price. For example, a discontinued Nikon D850 DSLR camera might sell for around ¥150,000 at a factory outlet, while the retail price is ¥250,000.

Here are some examples of prices for Nikon products at the Gotemba Premium Outlets:

Nikon D750 DSLR camera: ¥150,000 (retail price: ¥250,000)

Nikon 24-70mm f/2.8G ED lens: ¥80,000 (retail price: ¥120,000)

Nikon AF-S NIKKOR 50mm f/1.4G lens: ¥40,000 (retail price: ¥60,000)

Nikon Speedlight SB-910 flash: ¥20,000 (retail price: ¥30,000)

These are just a few examples, and the prices may vary depending on the outlet and the product. However, you can generally expect to save a significant amount of money on Nikon products at the factory outlet malls in Japan.

How much cheaper is Nikon Outlet in Japan?

The prices of Nikon products at the Nikon factory outlet in Japan can be significantly cheaper than the retail prices.

You can typically expect to save 20% to 50% off the retail price. For example, a discontinued Nikon D850 DSLR camera might sell for around ¥150,000 at a factory outlet, while the retail price is ¥250,000.

Here is a table of some examples of prices for Nikon products at the Gotemba Premium Outlets:

Nikon Outlet Locations In Japan

Toki Premium Outlets

Yes, there is a Nikon outlet in Toki Premium Outlets. It is located at 1-2 Tokigaoka, Toki, Gifu Prefecture, 509-5122, Japan. The outlet is open from 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM, 7 days a week.

This outlet is located in Gifu Prefecture, Japan. It is a small outlet with a limited selection of cameras and lenses, but you can often find some great deals.

The outlet has a wide selection of cameras, lenses, and accessories, and you can often find some great deals.

Here are some of the things you can find at the Nikon outlet in Toki Premium Outlets:

Cameras

Lenses

Flashes

Tripods

Bags

Memory cards

Filters

Cleaning kits

And more!

Here is the address and contact info:

Contact: +81572533160

Hours: 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM, daily

Website: https://www.premiumoutlets.co.jp/kobesanda/

Address: 1 Chome-2 Tokigaoka, Toki, Gifu 509-5127, Japan

Location:

Kobe-Sanda Premium Outlets

This outlet is located in Hyogo Prefecture, Japan. It is a larger outlet with a wider selection of cameras and lenses. You are more likely to find the latest models at this outlet, but the prices are not as good as at the Toki Premium Outlets.

Contact: +81 78 983 4122

Hours: 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM, daily

Website: https://www.premiumoutlets.co.jp/kobesanda/

Address: 7-3 Kozudai, Kita Ward, Kobe, Hyogo Prefecture 651-0093, Japan

Location:

Gotemba Premium Outlets

The Nikon outlet in Gotemba Premium Outlets is located at 1312 Fukasawa, Gotemba, Shizuoka Prefecture, 412-0023, Japan. The outlet is open from 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM, 7 days a week.

The Gotemba Premium Outlets is the largest Nikon factory outlet in Japan, and it has the widest selection of cameras, lenses, and accessories. You are most likely to find the best deals at this outlet, but it is also the most crowded.

This Gotemba Premium Outlets is located in Shizuoka Prefecture, Japan. It is the largest Nikon factory outlet in Japan and has the widest selection of cameras, lenses, and accessories. You are most likely to find the best deals at this outlet, but it is also the most crowded.

Contact: +81550813122

Hours: Monday to Friday: 10 AM–8 PM

Website: https://www.premiumoutlets.co.jp/gotemba/

Address: 1312 Fukasawa, Gotemba, Shizuoka 412-0023, Japan

Location:

Summary

The Gotemba Premium Outlets is the largest Nikon factory outlet in Japan, and it has the widest selection of cameras, lenses, and accessories. You are most likely to find the best deals at this outlet, but it is also the most crowded. The Toki Premium Outlets and Kobe-Sanda Premium Outlets are smaller, but they still have a good selection of products.

Nikon Outlet in Japan Hours

The Nikon factory outlets in Japan have different opening hours, so it is important to check the hours of operation before you visit.

Here are the opening hours for the three Nikon factory outlets in Japan:

Toki Premium Outlets: 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM, 7 days a week.

Kobe-Sanda Premium Outlets: 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM, 7 days a week.

Gotemba Premium Outlets: 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM, 7 days a week.

Does Nikon Outlets in Japan Have Sales?

Yes, Nikon outlets in Japan do have sales. The sales are typically held during the following times:

New Year's Sale: This sale is held in January and typically offers discounts of up to 50% off.

Summer Sale: This sale is held in July and August and typically offers discounts of up to 40% off.

End-of-Season Sale: This sale is held in November and December and typically offers discounts of up to 30% off.

In addition to these regular sales, the Nikon outlets in Japan may also have special sales on occasion. These sales may be announced on the Nikon website or on the outlets' social media pages.

Will there be another Nikon warehouse sale in 2023?

There is no official announcement yet from Nikon about whether there will be another warehouse sale in 2023.

However, Nikon has held warehouse sales in previous years, so it is possible that there will be another one in 2023.

If you are interested in attending a Nikon warehouse sale, it is a good idea to check the Nikon website or social media pages for announcements. Nikon usually announces warehouse sales a few weeks in advance.

Here are some tips for attending a Nikon warehouse sale:

Check the website or social media pages for announcements: Nikon usually announces warehouse sales a few weeks in advance. This is a great way to know when the sale is happening and where it will be held.

Be prepared to act quickly: Warehouse sales can be very popular, so it is important to be prepared to act quickly. The products may sell out quickly.

Bring cash: Nikon warehouse sales often do not accept credit cards. It is a good idea to bring cash with you to the sale.

Which is the best day to visit the Nikon Outlets in Japan?

The best day to visit the Nikon Outlets in Japan depends on the outlet and the time of year.

However, in general, weekdays are usually less crowded than weekends. If you are looking for a more relaxed shopping experience, weekdays are a good option.

Here are some of the factors to consider when choosing a day to visit the Nikon Outlets in Japan:

The time of year: The outlets are busiest during the holiday season and on weekends. If you are looking to avoid crowds, it is a good idea to visit during the off-season or on weekdays.

The outlet: Some outlets are more popular than others. If you are looking for a less crowded experience, it is a good idea to visit an outlet that is not as popular.

Your own schedule: Consider your own schedule when choosing a day to visit. If you have flexible hours, you may be able to visit during the week when the outlets are less crowded.

Can you bargain at the Nikon outlets?

Generally speaking, bargaining is not common in Japan, and it is not expected at Nikon outlets. The prices at the outlets are already discounted, so there is usually no room for negotiation.

However, there are a few cases where you may be able to bargain at a Nikon outlet.

If you are buying a discontinued model: Nikon outlets often sell discontinued models at a discounted price. If you are willing to buy a discontinued model, you may be able to bargain for a lower price.

If you are buying a used product: Nikon outlets also sell used products at a discounted price. If you are willing to buy a used product, you may be able to bargain for a lower price.

If you are buying a large quantity of products: If you are buying a large quantity of products, you may be able to bargain for a lower price.

However, it is important to note that bargaining is not guaranteed, and the staff at the outlet may not be willing to negotiate. If you are interested in bargaining, it is a good idea to be polite and respectful when you approach the staff.

Is Nikon Outlet Prices cheaper than online prices?

Generally speaking, yes, Nikon outlet prices tend to be cheaper than online prices. This is because Nikon outlets sell discontinued models, refurbished products, and open-box items at a discounted price.

However, there are a few cases where online prices may be cheaper than outlet prices. For example, if you are buying a brand new model, you may be able to find it for a lower price online.

Additionally, if you are buying a product from a third-party seller, you may be able to find it for a lower price than at an outlet.

What is the Nikon outlet's return policy in Japan?

Nikon outlets in Japan have a 14-day return policy for unopened items. If you purchase an item from a Nikon outlet in Japan and you are not satisfied with it, you can return it for a full refund within 14 days of purchase.

To return an item, you must bring the item to the outlet where you purchased it. You will need to present the original receipt. The item must be in its original packaging and in resalable condition.

If you purchase an item from a Nikon outlet in Japan and you open the package, you will not be able to return it for a refund. However, you may be able to exchange the item for a different item.

Are Nikon cameras still made in Japan?

As mentioned earlier, most Nikon cameras are now made in Thailand. However, there are still a few models that are made in Japan. These models include the Nikon D5, D500, and Z7.

Nikon has not announced any plans to stop making cameras in Japan, but it is possible that the company will move more production to Thailand in the future. This is due to the rising cost of labor in Japan.
